de.hotware.hotsound.audio.player

Interface MusicPlayer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    StreamMusicPlayer

    public interface MusicPlayer
extends java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Music Player interface. provides basic player methods and getters for a player.
    Author:
    Martin Braun

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canSeek() 
      void close()

      javax.sound.sampled.AudioFormat getAudioFormat() 
      void insert(Song pSong)
      Inserts a Song to the the Player.

      inserts a Song to the the Player possible difference between implementations: some could allow multiple songs to be added, but some could only hold one song at a time

      void restart()

      void skip(long pFrames)

      void stop()
      stops the playback but doesn't reset the Player. you can restart it via restartPlayback afterwards may lock the call if in multithreaded mode and the player is currently starting

    • Method Detail

      • insert

        void insert(Song pSong)
            throws MusicPlayerException
        Inserts a Song to the the Player. Possible difference between implementations: some could allow multiple songs to be added, but some could only hold one song at a time uses a default AudioDevice if there is not already one in usage (not closed)
        Throws:
        MusicPlayerException - if the insertion fails

      • insert

        void insert(Song pSong,
          AudioDevice pAudioDevice)
            throws MusicPlayerException
        inserts a Song to the the Player possible difference between implementations: some could allow multiple songs to be added, but some could only hold one song at a time
        Throws:
        MusicPlayerException

      • start

        void start()
           throws MusicPlayerException
        starts the playback
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the player hasn't been initialized yet (insert not called)
        MusicPlayerException - if there was an error during the start of the playback

      • pause

        void pause(boolean pPause)
        pauses/unpauses the playback
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the player hasn't been initialized yet (insert not called)

      • stop

        void stop()
          throws MusicPlayerException
        stops the playback but doesn't reset the Player. you can restart it via restartPlayback afterwards may lock the call if in multithreaded mode and the player is currently starting
        Throws:
        MusicPlayerException - if stopping fails
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the player hasn't been initialized yet (insert not called)

      • close

        void close()
           throws MusicPlayerException
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        MusicPlayerException - if close fails

      • isStopped

        boolean isStopped()
        Returns:
        true if stopped (not started or ended), false otherwise

      • isPaused

        boolean isPaused()
        Returns:
        true if started and paused (not ended), false otherwise

      • getAudioFormat

        javax.sound.sampled.AudioFormat getAudioFormat()
        Returns:
        the AudioFormat of the current song

      • getAudioDevice

        AudioDevice getAudioDevice()
        Returns:
        the AudioDevice of the current song

        void seek(long pFrame)
          throws MusicPlayerException
        seeks to the given position
